channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Effective Dual-Region Augmentation for Reduced Reliance on Large Amounts of Labeled Data
item.description: This paper introduces a novel dual-region augmentation approach designed to reduce reliance on large-scale labeled datasets while improving model robustness and adaptability across diverse computer vision tasks, including source-free domain adaptation (SFDA) and person re-identification (ReID).

item.title: Estimating Optimal Context Length for Hybrid Retrieval-augmented Multi-document Summarization
item.description: Our method first estimates the optimal retrieval length as a function of the retriever, summarizer, and dataset.

item.title: EchoWorld: Learning Motion-Aware World Models for Echocardiography Probe Guidance
item.description: To address this, we present EchoWorld, a motion-aware world modeling framework for probe guidance that encodes anatomical knowledge and motion-induced visual dynamics, while effectively leveraging past visual-motion sequences to enhance guidance precision.

item.title: Leave-One-Out Stable Conformal Prediction
item.description: Conformal prediction (CP) is an important tool for distribution-free predictive uncertainty quantification.

item.title: Generative and Explainable AI for High-Dimensional Channel Estimation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new adversarial training framework to address high-dimensional instantaneous channel estimation in wireless communications.

item.title: Zero-Shot Whole-Body Humanoid Control via Behavioral Foundation Models
item.description: Unsupervised reinforcement learning (RL) aims at pre-training agents that can solve a wide range of downstream tasks in complex environments.

item.title: TextArena
item.description: TextArena is an open-source collection of competitive text-based games for training and evaluation of agentic behavior in Large Language Models (LLMs).

item.title: Data driven approach towards more efficient Newton-Raphson power flow calculation for distribution grids
item.description: Power flow (PF) calculations are fundamental to power system analysis to ensure stable and reliable grid operation.

item.title: Transfer Learning for Temporal Link Prediction
item.description: Temporal link prediction (TLP) refers to predicting future links in a temporally evolving graph and adds additional complexity related to the dynamic nature of graphs.

item.title: DataSentinel: A Game-Theoretic Detection of Prompt Injection Attacks
item.description: Specifically, DataSentinel fine-tunes an LLM to detect inputs contaminated with injected prompts that are strategically adapted to evade detection.

item.title: Foundation models for electronic health records: representation dynamics and transferability
item.description: Foundation models (FMs) trained on electronic health records (EHRs) have shown strong performance on a range of clinical prediction tasks.

item.title: NTIRE 2025 Challenge on Cross-Domain Few-Shot Object Detection: Methods and Results
item.description: Cross-Domain Few-Shot Object Detection (CD-FSOD) poses significant challenges to existing object detection and few-shot detection models when applied across domains.

item.title: REPA-E: Unlocking VAE for End-to-End Tuning with Latent Diffusion Transformers
item.description: We show that while diffusion loss is ineffective, end-to-end training can be unlocked through the representation-alignment (REPA) loss -- allowing both VAE and diffusion model to be jointly tuned during the training process.

item.title: A Survey of Personalization: From RAG to Agent
item.description: Personalization has become an essential capability in modern AI systems, enabling customized interactions that align with individual user preferences, contexts, and goals.

item.title: Pixel-SAIL: Single Transformer For Pixel-Grounded Understanding
item.description: We present Pixel-SAIL, a single transformer for pixel-wise MLLM tasks.

item.title: MIEB: Massive Image Embedding Benchmark
item.description: We introduce the Massive Image Embedding Benchmark (MIEB) to evaluate the performance of image and image-text embedding models across the broadest spectrum to date.

item.title: OctGPT: Octree-based Multiscale Autoregressive Models for 3D Shape Generation
item.description: In this paper, we introduce OctGPT, a novel multiscale autoregressive model for 3D shape generation that dramatically improves the efficiency and performance of prior 3D autoregressive approaches, while rivaling or surpassing state-of-the-art diffusion models.

item.title: RGB-Event based Pedestrian Attribute Recognition: A Benchmark Dataset and An Asymmetric RWKV Fusion Framework
item.description: In this paper, we revisit these issues and propose a novel multi-modal RGB-Event attribute recognition task by drawing inspiration from the advantages of event cameras in low-light, high-speed, and low-power consumption.

item.title: Two Heads are Better Than One: Test-time Scaling of Multi-agent Collaborative Reasoning
item.description: In this work, we introduce an adaptive multi-agent framework designed to enhance collaborative reasoning through both model-level training and system-level coordination.

item.title: LLM-SRBench: A New Benchmark for Scientific Equation Discovery with Large Language Models
item.description: Scientific equation discovery is a fundamental task in the history of scientific progress, enabling the derivation of laws governing natural phenomena.

item.title: Trade-offs in Privacy-Preserving Eye Tracking through Iris Obfuscation: A Benchmarking Study
item.description: Considering all, in this paper, we benchmark blurring, noising, downsampling, rubber sheet model, and iris style transfer to obfuscate user identity, and compare their impact on image quality, privacy, utility, and risk of imposter attack on two datasets.

item.title: Revisiting Self-Attentive Sequential Recommendation
item.description: Quite some details in the classical self-attentive sequential recommender model could be revisited, and some new experiments may lead to new findings, without changing the general model structure which was the focus of many previous works.

item.title: GRPO-LEAD: A Difficulty-Aware Reinforcement Learning Approach for Concise Mathematical Reasoning in Language Models
item.description: Recent advances in R1-like reasoning models leveraging Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO) have significantly improved the performance of language models on mathematical reasoning tasks.

item.title: 3D CoCa: Contrastive Learners are 3D Captioners
item.description: 3D captioning, which aims to describe the content of 3D scenes in natural language, remains highly challenging due to the inherent sparsity of point clouds and weak cross-modal alignment in existing methods.

item.title: Tokenize Image Patches: Global Context Fusion for Effective Haze Removal in Large Images
item.description: Global contextual information and local detail features are essential for haze removal tasks.

item.title: Dynamik: Syntactically-Driven Dynamic Font Sizing for Emphasis of Key Information
item.description: In today's globalized world, there are increasing opportunities for individuals to communicate using a common non-native language (lingua franca).

item.title: Uncertainty Guided Refinement for Fine-Grained Salient Object Detection
item.description: To address this, we introduce the uncertainty guidance learning approach to SOD, intended to enhance the model's perception of uncertain regions.

item.title: Explorer: Robust Collection of Interactable GUI Elements
item.description: We mostly assume that the target application is known in advance, so that data collection and ML-training can be personalized for the test-time target domain.

item.title: seeBias: A Comprehensive Tool for Assessing and Visualizing AI Fairness
item.description: Fairness in artificial intelligence (AI) prediction models is increasingly emphasized to support responsible adoption in high-stakes domains such as health care and criminal justice.

item.title: Task Memory Engine (TME): Enhancing State Awareness for Multi-Step LLM Agent Tasks
item.description: In this work, we propose the Task Memory Engine (TME), a lightweight and structured memory module that tracks task execution using a hierarchical Task Memory Tree (TMT).

item.title: RouterKT: Mixture-of-Experts for Knowledge Tracing
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose RouterKT, a novel Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architecture designed to capture heterogeneous learning patterns by enabling experts to specialize in different patterns without any handcrafted learning pattern bias such as forgetting decay.

item.title: MSCCL++: Rethinking GPU Communication Abstractions for Cutting-edge AI Applications
item.description: This paper discusses an alternative communication library interface for AI applications that offers both portability and performance by reducing redundant efforts while maintaining flexibility for customization.

item.title: RAG-VR: Leveraging Retrieval-Augmented Generation for 3D Question Answering in VR Environments
item.description: Recent advances in large language models (LLMs) provide new opportunities for context understanding in virtual reality (VR).

item.title: F$^3$Set: Towards Analyzing Fast, Frequent, and Fine-grained Events from Videos
item.description: Analyzing Fast, Frequent, and Fine-grained (F$^3$) events presents a significant challenge in video analytics and multi-modal LLMs.

item.title: Optimizing Power Grid Topologies with Reinforcement Learning: A Survey of Methods and Challenges
item.description: Power grid operation is becoming increasingly complex due to the rising integration of renewable energy sources and the need for more adaptive control strategies.

item.title: MooseAgent: A LLM Based Multi-agent Framework for Automating Moose Simulation
item.description: This paper proposes an automated solution framework, MooseAgent, for the multi-physics simulation framework MOOSE, which combines large-scale pre-trained language models (LLMs) with a multi-agent system.

item.title: Beyond Black-Box Predictions: Identifying Marginal Feature Effects in Tabular Transformer Networks
item.description: However, this predictive power comes at the cost of intelligibility: Marginal feature effects are almost completely lost in the black-box nature of deep tabular transformer networks.

item.title: TensorNEAT: A GPU-accelerated Library for NeuroEvolution of Augmenting Topologies
item.description: In addition to NEAT, the library supports variants such as CPPN and HyperNEAT, and integrates with benchmark environments like Gym, Brax, and gymnax.

item.title: MBE-ARI: A Multimodal Dataset Mapping Bi-directional Engagement in Animal-Robot Interaction
item.description: Animal-robot interaction (ARI) remains an unexplored challenge in robotics, as robots struggle to interpret the complex, multimodal communication cues of animals, such as body language, movement, and vocalizations.

item.title: TorchFX: A modern approach to Audio DSP with PyTorch and GPU acceleration
item.description: In response, we introduce TorchFX: a GPU-accelerated Python library for DSP, specifically engineered to facilitate sophisticated audio signal processing.

item.title: Reverberation-based Features for Sound Event Localization and Detection with Distance Estimation
item.description: Only recently, SELD was extended to 3D by incorporating distance estimation, enabling the prediction of sound event positions in 3D space (3D SELD).

item.title: SN-LiDAR: Semantic Neural Fields for Novel Space-time View LiDAR Synthesis
item.description: To address this challenge, we propose SN-LiDAR, a method that jointly performs accurate semantic segmentation, high-quality geometric reconstruction, and realistic LiDAR synthesis.

item.title: The More is not the Merrier: Investigating the Effect of Client Size on Federated Learning
item.description: We find a significant deterioration of learning accuracy for FedAvg as the number of clients increases.

item.title: ProtoECGNet: Case-Based Interpretable Deep Learning for Multi-Label ECG Classification with Contrastive Learning
item.description: Deep learning-based electrocardiogram (ECG) classification has shown impressive performance but clinical adoption has been slowed by the lack of transparent and faithful explanations.

item.title: Cut-and-Splat: Leveraging Gaussian Splatting for Synthetic Data Generation
item.description: Generating synthetic images is a useful method for cheaply obtaining labeled data for training computer vision models.

item.title: Muon-Accelerated Attention Distillation for Real-Time Edge Synthesis via Optimized Latent Diffusion
item.description: We propose Muon-AD, a co-designed framework that integrates the Muon optimizer with attention distillation for real-time edge synthesis.

item.title: MedRep: Medical Concept Representation for General Electronic Health Record Foundation Models
item.description: To deal with this problem, we propose MedRep for EHR foundation models based on the observational medical outcome partnership (OMOP) common data model (CDM), providing the integrated medical concept representations and the basic data augmentation strategy for patient trajectories.

item.title: Latent Diffusion Autoencoders: Toward Efficient and Meaningful Unsupervised Representation Learning in Medical Imaging
item.description: This study presents Latent Diffusion Autoencoder (LDAE), a novel encoder-decoder diffusion-based framework for efficient and meaningful unsupervised learning in medical imaging, focusing on Alzheimer disease (AD) using brain MR from the ADNI database as a case study.

item.title: CG-TGAN: Conditional Generative Adversarial Networks with Graph Neural Networks for Tabular Data Synthesizing
item.description: The synthesized tabular data should reflect the relational meaning between columns of tabular data, so modeling the probability distribution of tabular data is a non-trivial task.

item.title: Deep Learning Methods for Detecting Thermal Runaway Events in Battery Production Lines
item.description: In this work, we investigate the use of deep learning for detecting thermal runaway in the battery production line of VDL Nedcar, a Dutch automobile manufacturer.
